intro: Erigeron spathulifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are broadly ovate to spoon-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall.
